title: Requires average monthly rate increase information to all residents of assisted living facilities
summary: Requires average monthly rate increase information be provided to all residents of assisted living facilities; exempts nonprofit assisted living residences.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1927

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. ROSENTHAL, GOTTFRIED, DINOWITZ, COOK, MILLMAN,
         SCHIMEL, CAHILL, KELLNER -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of  A.  BOYLAND,
         V. LOPEZ, J. RIVERA, ROBINSON, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Health

       AN  ACT  to amend the public health law, in relation to the provision of
         average monthly rate increases information to  assisted  living  resi-
         dents

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.   Title 4 of article 46-B  of  the  public  health  law  is
    2  amended by adding a new section 4664 to read as follows:
    3    S  4664.  ASSISTED LIVING RESIDENCE; PROVISION OF AVERAGE MONTHLY RATE
    4  INCREASE INFORMATION. 1. ON OR BEFORE JANUARY THIRTY-FIRST OF EACH YEAR,
    5  THE OPERATOR OF AN ASSISTED  LIVING  RESIDENCE  SHALL  DISCLOSE  TO  THE
    6  FACILITY'S  CURRENT RESIDENTS ITS AVERAGE MONTHLY RATE INCREASES, INCLU-
    7  SIVE OF RENT AND SERVICE FEES, FOR EACH OF THE PREVIOUS THREE YEARS. THE
    8  OPERATOR SHALL DISCLOSE BOTH THE  ACTUAL  AND  AVERAGE  AMOUNT  OF  EACH
    9  INCREASE, AS WELL AS THE AVERAGE PERCENTAGE OF INCREASE.
   10    2. (A) THE OPERATOR SHALL POST THE INFORMATION REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION
   11  ONE OF THIS SECTION ON THE FRONT DOOR OF THE FACILITY, OR IN A PROMINENT
   12  LOCATION  NO  MORE  THAN  TEN FEET FROM THE FACILITY'S MAIN ENTRANCE AND
   13  PROVIDE SUCH INFORMATION TO THE DEPARTMENT.
   14    (B) THE DEPARTMENT SHALL POST THE INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE ASSISTED
   15  LIVING RESIDENCE, PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, ON  ITS
   16  WEBSITE.
   17    3.  EACH RESIDENT SHALL SIGN A CONFIRMATION OF RECEIPT OF THE INFORMA-
   18  TION REQUIRED BY THIS SECTION, WHICH SHALL BE MAINTAINED BY THE FACILITY
   19  IN THE RESIDENT'S FILE.
   20    4. THE OPERATOR SHALL PROVIDE A COPY OF THE  INFORMATION  REQUIRED  BY
   21  THIS SECTION TO ANY PROSPECTIVE RESIDENT OR HIS OR HER REPRESENTATIVE AS
   22  PART OF ITS GENERAL INFORMATION MATERIALS.
   23    5.  ALL  NONPROFIT ASSISTED LIVING RESIDENCES SHALL BE EXEMPT FROM THE
   24  PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01775-01-1
